author: Redacción LAVOZ
title: Juan Cruz Real y la derrota de Belgrano: Estoy tranquilo pero dolido
text: [Belgrano perdió en su visita a Lanús por 2-3](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/deportes/futbol/errores-que-el-equipo-pago-con-una-derrota-las-claves-del-2-3-ante-lanus-por-la-liga-profesional/) en el marco de la séptima fecha de la Liga Profesional. El entrenador celeste sentenció: “Estoy con dolor por el resultado. Queríamos venir a ganar a un plaza difícil, pese a que tenemos que mejorar cosas, nos faltó encontrar al hombre libre entrelíneas, estoy tranquilo con lo mostrado por los jugadores. Jugamos el partido con protagonismo. Me da tranquilidad con lo que tenemos”. “No me cambia nada lo que pienso de los jugadores cuando plantamos cara así. Los jugadores hicieron honor de lo que habla Belgrano de ir al frente, fuimos al frente todo el partido, aun perdiendo 3-1, seguimos jugando, intentando. El rival tiene una idea de juego que se basa mucho en defender en su campo y contraatacar, pero estuvimos en juego hasta el final”, agregó. “En el primer tiempo tuvimos algunas ocasiones que pudimos definir, hubo una situación que nos da la sensación que hubo penal a Barinaga. Creo que desde el desarrollo de juego superamos al rival. Estoy tranquilo pero dolido”, sumó Real. “Marcamos una tendencia que somos fuerte de local, que queríamos lograr, y queremos llevar esa fortaleza también a ser un equipo difícil de visitante. Lo malo es el resultado. Lo bueno hay bastante”, remarcó el entrenador de Belgrano. “Estoy conforme con todo el plantel, por como venimos evolucionando desde el juego. Creo que el equipo tiene ya una identidad clara. Obviamente tenemos que profundizar el momento del juego, en funcionamiento, que eso lo va dando la semana de trabajo, los partidos, las experiencias que vamos teniendo”, expresó Real. “La evolución que hemos tenido como equipo es notoria y hoy Belgrano en cada partido que juega, tanto de local como de visitante, tiene una idea definida de juego, o sea que sabe a que juega Belgrano. Después, el techo nuestro está muy lejos, tenemos muchas cosas para mejorar. En líneas generales, todo el plantel evolucionó”, siguió el DT. Consultado por la salida, en el entretiempo, de Bryan Reyna, Real dijo: “El cambio de Velázquez es una decisión que tomamos, de acuerdo a lo que queríamos buscar para el segundo tiempo, mejorar la funcionalidad del que estaba jugando”. Sobre los refuerzos que espera, Real indicó que “Estamos en la búsqueda. La idea es no traer muchos, traer poco y que potencien lo que ya tenemos, siempre y cuando no se vaya nadie. Necesitamos que venga un arquero para competir con Nacho (Chicco)”.

title: EULA Home Care Agency Reaffirms Its Dedication to Home Care in Kannapolis, NC | User | theeveningleader.com
text:
EULA Home Care Agency in Kannapolis, NC, reaffirms its commitment to providing top-notch, personalized home care for seniors. With a focus on enhancing quality of life and independence, EULA offers tailored care plans to meet the unique needs of each family. Discover compassionate, professional care that makes a difference. Visit https://eulahomecare.com for more details. Kannapolis, NC - EULA Home Care Agency, a leader in home care services, today announced its steadfast commitment to the Kannapolis community by continuing to offer high-quality home care. This announcement reassures local families seeking exceptional senior care in Kannapolis that they can depend on EULA Home Care Agency for unparalleled support aimed at enhancing the quality of life and comfort for their elderly loved ones within their homes. This dedication is a direct response to the ongoing demand from the community for dependable and superior home care solutions, emphasizing the importance of personalized care plans and the overall well-being of each senior under their care.
Davetta Williams, owner of EULA Home Care Agency, states, “Our commitment to the Kannapolis community is stronger than ever. We recognize the importance of providing personalized and compassionate care to our seniors, ensuring they lead dignified and fulfilling lives. As we continue to serve the evolving needs of our community, our resolve to offer exceptional senior care remains unwavering, focusing on meeting the unique needs of each family and individual in our care.”
EULA Home Care Agency's approach to home care is deeply personalized and designed to meet each senior's needs. From essential daily living assistance to more comprehensive care needs, this tailored approach ensures seniors' enhanced quality of life, fostering independence, comfort, and overall well-being.
For more information about EULA Home Care Agency and their home care in Kannapolis, NC , please visit their website at https://eulahomecare.com
About EULA Home Care Agency:
EULA Home Care Agency is a premier provider of home care services in Kannapolis, NC. Renowned for its commitment to excellence and a team of dedicated care professionals, EULA Home Care Agency offers a broad spectrum of services tailored to the senior population's varied needs. Dedicated to improving the lives of seniors and their families, EULA Home Care Agency remains the first choice for those searching for compassionate, high-quality care in the comfort of their homes.

author: H M Chaithanya Swamy
title: Techie: Techie clings to scooter, catches phone snatcher | Bengaluru News
text: A 36-year-old techie latched on to the speeding scooter of a robber who had snatched his phone and clung to it for nearly 150 metres recently near Town Hall, before the culprit lost control of his vehicle and fell down. The techie, with help from passersby, caught him.Sangamesh, who resides in RPC Layout near Vijaya Nagar and works in a firm at Sarjapur, sustained injuries on his knees and hand. The accused - Syed Athik, 23, from Tipu Nagar in Chamarajpet - was thrashed by the public before being handed over to police. Athik is a dropout and a habitual offender, police said.On December 26, while waiting for his friend at the bus stop on NR Road at 7.15pm, Sangamesh took out his phone to call a family member. Before the call got connected, scooter-borne Athik stopped next to him and snatched the phone. \"As he tried to escape, I held on to the scooter's seat handle to stop him. The miscreant raised the accelerator and dragged me for more than 150 metres towards KR Market. People shouted at him and started running behind the vehicle. He lost balance and fell on the road. I immediately got up and went to him. People came to my help and they caught him,\" Sangamesh said.He said he didn't want the culprit to escape at any cost. \"But later, I realised if he had taken the BGS flyover, I would have been run over. Another stroke of luck was that the vehicles coming from Town Hall junction towards KR Market had stopped as the signal had turned red. So the road was empty,\" he said. Athik had tampered with his scooter's number plates and was wearing a mask to avoid being detected. He suffered knee injury in the fall.
